title: Monopole Catalyzed Baryogenesis with a $\theta$ angle
authors: T. Daniel Brennan, Lian-Tao Wang, Huangyu Xiao
abstract:
Monopoles are generally expected in Grand Unified Theories (GUTs) where they
can catalyze baryon decay at an unsuppressed rate by the Callan-Rubakov effect.
For the first time, we show this catalysis effect can generate the observed
baryon asymmetry at GeV scale temperatures. We study the minimal SU(5) GUT
model and demonstrate that monopoles-fermion scattering with a $CP$-violating
$\theta$-term leads to realistic baryogenesis even when $\theta\lesssim
10^{-10}$ is below the neutron EDM bound, potentially detectable in the future
measurements. Our calculation also shows that to generate the observed baryon
asymmetry, the abundance of the monopoles is below the current experiential
bounds.
